results.title: Faithless = Trolosa [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Liv Ullman, Kaj Larsen, Ab Svensk Film Industri, Sf Norge As, SVT Drama, Yle Vianello and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Liv Ullman, best known for her acting in iconic films by Ingmar Bergman, directs “Faithless”, from a script by Bergman. “Faithless” is the story of a bourgeois Swedish family whose lives are put asunder by an extra-marital affair. Marianne (Lena Andre) is happily married to composer Markus (Thomas Hanzon), living with their young daughter, Isabelle. David (Krister Henriksson), a friend to both Marianne and Markus, is a hapless writer and theatre director, onto his troubled second marriage, and a frequent visitor to the family home. David is depicted as a charming rogue with a self-destructive streak, filled with self-loathing. One night, when Markus is away on tour, David proposes to Marianne that they sleep together. Marianne refuses but her interest is piqued and the sanctity of her family unit is doomed. Told in extended flashback sequences, Marianne relays her story to the narrator, Bergman (Erland Josephson), who listens patiently, coercing Marianne to confess her indiscretions. This set-up, at a beautiful, remote beachside retreat, is reminiscent of many Ingmar Bergman films, in particular “Persona”. “Faithless” employs a leisurely pace to unfurl this tale of morality, betrayal, love and revenge, between three consenting adults and an innocent child. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Exorcist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, William Peter Blatty and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Exorcist occupies a central position in the history of horror films, an almost sadistically malevolent experience in terror. Regan (Linda Blair) is a young girl entering puberty and she becomes possessed by the spirit of an ancient demon. Her mother (Ellen Burstyn) finds that there is no assistance in the scientific pragmatism of the modern world and she hesitantly turns to the occult rites of Catholicism and Orthodoxy in order to rid her daughter of the monster. The exorcism scenes attain a disturbing authenticity and they are based on the official Catholic Church rites of exorcism. “The Exorcist” is a film that feeds on our most intimate fears and terrors and not a film for the easily frightened. Stars Max Van Sydow as Father Merrin. Based on the book by William Peter Blatty. Mercedes McCambridge is the voice of the Devil. Part of Tubular Bell by Mike Oldfield used on the soundtrack.

results.title: Natural born killers [Director's cut] [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, Clayton Townsend, Don Murphy, Jane Hamsher, JD Productions, New Regency Pictures and Xtlan
results.brief_description: Oliver Stone’s unflinching macabre black comedy is possibly one of the most despairing films, a destructive romp through American popular culture witnessed through the eyes of Mickey and Mallory (Woody Harrelson and Juliette Lewis), two young serial killers. From the sit-com parody of Mallory’s sexual abuse by her father (Rodney Dangerfield) - it comes complete with laughtrack - to the apocalyptic jail riot that cements the killers’ reputations as cultural heroes, “Natural Born Killers” presents a vehement hate-letter to television and media technologies. The cast is outstanding, including Robert Downey Jr who is very funny as a sicko Australian compere of a television show that celebrates mass murder and Tommy Lee Jones as the psycho-warden of a top-security prison. “Natural Born Killers” is violent, obscene and extravagant, a rollercoaster through the media sewers of the United States. It is also a brilliant collision of filmmaking styles; with everything from music video to the avant-garde, from porn to propaganda. Features a suitably fiery soundtrack of industrial metal, punk, Arabic chants and hardcore techno. Cast also includes Robert Downey Jr., Tommy Lee Jones and Tom Sizemore.

results.title: Libera, my love = Libera, amore mio [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Set in Italy between 1936 and 1946 Claudia Cardinale portrays a woman fighting against her country’s growing fascism. Libera’s political resistance leads to her exile, along with her husband, on the same island that her father (Adolfo Celi) had been sentenced for his anti Mussoilini politics. There she becomes attracted to another internee (Bekim Fehmiu) but her principles cause her to restrain her passion. After the outbreak of war, Libera’s personal vendetta against the Brown-shirts fuels her anti-fascist activism. Also stars Bruno Cirino and Philippe Leroy. Music by Enrio Morricone. Photographed by Franco Di Giacomo. Edited by Nini Baragli.

results.title: Evolution
results.creator_credit: Ivan Reitman, Daniel Goldberg, Joe Medjuck, Columbia Pictures and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Seann William Scott and Julianne Moore star in this Sci-Fi comedy about a team of unlikely heroes trying to save the world from an alien invasion. Wayne Green, a wannabe fireman is practising for his fireman’s test when a meteor crashes into his car. He calls in the police who, in turn, call in college professor Ira Kane and his friend, geologist Harry Block. Together, they discover the meteor was carrying single-celled organisms which were evolving at a fast rate. When strange creatures appear in the area surrounding the meteor and start attacking the government is called in to investigate. When the trio discovers the government’s plan to destroy the aliens will actually cause them to reproduce faster, Ira, Harry and Wayne - with the assistance of Government scientist Allison Reed, attempt to save the day. Directed by Ivan Reitman, “Evolution” borrows jokes from his film “Ghostbusters” as well as from the hit film “Men in Black”. Cast also includes Dan Aykroyd in a cameo role as the Governor of Arizona.

results.title: Moulin Rouge
results.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Fred Baron, Philip Martin Brown, Jill Bilcock, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Catherine Martin
results.brief_description: The third instalment in Baz Luhrmann’s ‘Red curtain’ trilogy (made up of “Strictly Ballroom” and “Romeo and Juliet”), “Moulin Rouge” is a kinetic and gaudy paean to the infamous Paris nightclub. Borrowing its cues from just about every pop song written in the last century from Marc Bolan to Kurt Cobain, this ferociously paced musical tells the tragi-comic tale of doomed lovers Satine (Nicole Kidman) and Christian (Ewan McGregor). Apart from the countless Hollywood musicals it borrows from, “Moulin Rouge” ultimately takes it’s inspiration from the classic Orpheus and Eurydice tale, substituting 1900’s Paris for the underworld that Orpheus descends into in order to rescue his true love. Kidman’s Satine (played as a larger than life Marilyn Monroe), is the collectively worshiped dance hall queen of the Moulin Rouge who falls for the hapless poet, Christian. McGregor brings genuine feeling to his role as the innocent dreamer who learns the hard way of the darkness lurking behind the seductive glamour of the Paris night scene. Luhrmann has much fun with this decorative folly, not stopping for a breath as he moves from one outlandish set to another. Everything is pitched at the most broadest level from the performances (Richard Roxburgh is beyond camp as the slippery Duke of Monroth), to the manic camera work which zooms from the smallest detail to the highest roof top in a single leap. Cast includes Jim Broadbent, Richard Roxburgh, John Leguizamo, Garry McDonald, Christine Anu, Kylie Minogue, David Wenham and Kerry Walker.

results.title: Sleuth
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Morton Gottlieb, Palomar Pictures International and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Milo Tindle (Michael Caine), a former hairdresser, finds himself invited to cocktails by renowned mystery writer, Andrew Wkye (Laurence Olivier). Wyke’s 16th century residence is a treasure trove of games paraphernalia - dart boards, chess sets, robots and mazes, and Tindle is about to join the accoutrements. When Wyke reveals that he knows about Milo’s involvement with his estranged wife, Marguerite (Margo Channing), he devises a ploy to avoid paying alimony - a ploy that involves Tindle robbing his lover so that Wyke can claim on the insurance money. A power struggle ensues between the younger, middle class rival and the blue blood, upper-class ageing mystery writer. This taut, 3 character film was nominated for 3 Academy awards and was Mankiewicz’s final film. Based on the stage play by Anthony Shaffer.

results.title: The Cup
results.creator_credit: Khyentse Norbu, Malcolm Watson, Raymond Steiner, Hanway Films and Palm Pictures
results.brief_description: It is 1998 and World Cup fever has reached as far as a monastery in the Indian Himalayas. Here, young Orgyen and fellow monks are taken with the excitement of the cup final approaching, their only dilemma is how are they going to be able to watch the final without a TV. ‘The Cup’ is a delightful comedy that looks at how a group of novice monks can come up with money to rent a TV and seek the permission of their leader, Geko, who is firm handed, and Khempo, the older and slightly more easy going leader. Written and directed by Khyentse Norbu who was himself a Buddhist monk, this is the first film to be released in the Tibetan language. In Bhutanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Paragraph 175
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Friedman, Robert Epstein, Channel Four Films, Home Box Office and Telling Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary about the Nazi persecution of homosexuals during the Third Reich, reveals the lasting consequences of this little known chapter of 20th century history through the personal recollections of six survivors. Between 1933 and 1945, 100,000 men were arrested for homosexuality under Paragraph 175, the unenforced sodomy provision of the German penal code dating back to 1871. Some were imprisoned, others were sent to concentration camps. Of the latter, only about 4,000 survived. By the 1920s, Berlin had become known as a homosexual Eden where gay men and lesbians lived relatively open lives amidst a thriving community of artists and intellectuals, however with the coming to power of the Nazis, Paragraph 175 was revived to brutally crush this culture. Combined with archival images and an historical account of gay culture preceding and during the Third Reich, the moving testimonies of the now very elderly five men and one women raise provocative questions about memory, history, and identity. In English, German and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Grace of my heart
results.creator_credit: Allison Anders, Daniel Hassid, Elliott Lewis Rose, Ruth Charny, Cappa, Gramercy Pictures and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: In “Grace of My Heart” Allison Anders has used a number of rock’n roll reference points, creating character pastiches of famed musicians, producers and industry types. None of the characters directly match up to their real life counterparts, but the similarities are clear. Broadly based on the life of Carol King, ” Grace of My Heart” tells the story of Denise Waverly (Illeana Douglas), who starts her career as a want to be singer from Philadelphia, and goes on to become a successful songwriter. The story traces the long journey of personal discovery she must go through to ultimately become all that she wants to be. The film sets itself among the corridors of the famed Brill Building during the doo-wop heyday of the late fifties all the way through Malibu’s psychedelic surfer scene of the late sixties. With period costuming and a wall-to-wall pop soundtrack featuring the likes of Elvis Costello, Burt Bacharach, Lesley Gore, Carole Bayer Sager, J Mascis and Sonic Youth. Also starring John Turturro as Denise’s mentor and record-producer, Eric Stoltz as husband number 1, and Matt Dillon as husband number 2.
